http://www.guardian.co.uk/uk_news/story/0,,1468481,00.html
 
 Is this finally a sign that people are prepared to stand and be counted in their opposition to Israeli "apartheid" or just more anti semitism?

post_info.post_title: Lecturers vote to boycott Israeli universities

Given that the boycott is related to specific instances of support for the occupation by the universities concerned, and allows exemptions for those academics who are openly critical of Israeli policy I don't think the boycott itself is anti-semetic. The views of some of its supporters are, however, open to question.

....And out comes the "holocaust guilt card"
 
 
"The last time that Jews were boycotted in universities was in 1930s Germany."

when will people stop using that and actually view the problems Israel has and has created? 
 
 The second anyone says anything bad about Israel that card instantly flies out. 
 
 Shesh, I don't even care that they are Jewish. They could be half turkomen Amerindians and I would still have my digs with Israel.
